relation: NATURAL GAS PIPELINE CO OF AMERICA
pageTitle: PHMSA: Stakeholder Communications - Corrective Action Orders Closed
title: Summary of Corrective Action Orders Closed: 2011 (1)
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {2156=This report lists all of the Corrective Action Orders closed in a given year, beginning in 2002. The yearly tables include the date the Corrective Action Order was issued, the name of the operator involved, the PHMSA Region initiating the enforcement action(s), the corresponding date on which the case was closed, and PHMSA's unique case number. Corrective Action Orders identify the specific corrective actions an operator must take to address conditions that may be hazardous to people, property, or the environment. Only after PHMSA verifies that all actions specified in Corrective Action Orders have been satisfactorily completed and the facility is no longer hazardous is the case closed. Corrective Action Orders are described in 49 CFR 190.233.}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {52131=Information provided on this website is intended to enhance public understanding of PHMSA's enforcement program. Aggregate and company-specific statistical information reflecting PHMSA's enforcement actions is provided beginning with 2002. Key documents associated with new administrative enforcement cases are provided beginning with 2007. Agency orders issued since 2002 are also provided. The search feature may not retrieve every document associated with each individual enforcement action. Enforcement data is updated monthly as additional cases are initiated and other cases are resolved. Historical totals will change over time to reflect changes in case status.}
